text: In Greek mythology, Dotis (Ancient Greek: Δωτίδος) was the son of Asterius and Amphictyone (herself daughter of Phthius). According to Pherecydes (c. 450 BC), he was the eponym of the city Dotion (Dotium) in Thessaly. Alternate mythical eponyms were Dotia, daughter of Elatus, and Dotus, son of either Pelasgus or Neonus the son of Hellen.Stephanus of Byzantium, s. v. Dōtion (5th century AD) == References == Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Dotis of Thessaly
